page.title: 14A Car Survey in Pury End
page.content:
There are about ninety houses in Pury End and when we did our survey we spoke to people in thirty-two of them.
The most common car was the Ford Fiesta (cost around four thousand pounds) and the car which people would have if money was no object would be a Porshe (cost between fifteen thousand and seventy-four thousand pounds). There were three people who had four-wheel-drive vehicles. Twenty-nine had radios and twenty-one had cassette players in their cars. Most people seem to get a new car every five years or so and the average annual mileage of the participants in the survey was about twelve thousand.
